Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Goblins: A ragtag army of crude, barbaric goblins set out to conquer and destroy. Some wield dark, evil magic.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Pirates: A seafaring horde of armed bandits that lust after the riches of the land, collecting treasures and taking no prisoners.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Martian: Technologically advanced beings from another world who want to eradicate all primitive life with their superior weaponry.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_OldOnesArmy: Minions from Etheria - they may have mistakenly invaded this world, but they wish to rule it nonetheless!
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_PumpkinMoon: A bitter harvest rises in the dead of night. Creatures of evil and darkness spook the lands, killing everything in their path.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_FrostMoon: Ho Ho Ho! On this not-so-silent night, festive beings wish to shower the world with gifts of blood and carnage.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_FrostLegion: This organized family of cold-hearted killers wish to ice any who cross them, and they don't like snitches... capisce?
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_SlimeRain: For reasons beyond any meteorological explanation, slimy things are raining down from above by the buckets!
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_WindyDay: Don't get carried away! Nature is throwing a party and wishes to sweep everybody - and everything - off their feet!
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_BloodMoon: When the moon rises drenched in blood, the dead rise with it! These macabre creatures seek to add fresh meat to their dripping ranks.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Halloween: Pumpkins grow wildly across the land, and certain creatures masquerade in unusual costumes. Trick or treat!
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Rain: When it rains, it pours. Creatures which normally thrive in water may roam the land and sky. Beware the angered clouds.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Christmas: Winter is here! Time to celebrate with twinkling lights, ugly sweaters, and a fat old fellow wearing a bright red suit.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Eclipse: Familiar creatures of horror rapidly grip the lands this day, for no mere mortal can resist the evil of the blackened sun.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Party: This day, for no particular reason, everyone decided to throw a party. There's always time for a celebration!
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Blizzard: The most vile, stone-cold entities emerge in the blinding chaos of bone-piercing icy wind and snow. Every step is cold and dangerous.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Sandstorm: The sands of the desert rage like a stormy sea, with deadly creatures swimming among them.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Surface: Anywhere where one can see the trees, the mountains, and the sky. Not all creatures are powerful or even hostile.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Graveyard: When areas of death become littered with graves, a thick mist of concentrated eeriness blankets the land.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_UndergroundJungle: The tangled world beneath the muddy jungle proves perilous to any adventurer. Within, be on guard for voracious plants and bugs.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_TheUnderworld: A doomed haven of fire and brimstone - run rampant with demons and devils - offers no sanctuary for the living.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_TheDungeon: Constructed long ago as a once thriving city, this dark and evil place now serves as the home for its cursed former inhabitants.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_TheCorruption: A cancerous Corruption thriving off the sins of the living. Its sole desire is to consume all things, leaving behind only a lifeless void.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Underground: Just below the surface, there's no shortage of dirt. Basic ore, mundane treasure, and weak monsters live down there.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_TheHallow: A divine and overzealous force, 'The Hallow', serves as a cure to combat evil with its majestic, powerful creatures of light.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_UndergroundMushroom: A curious deviation of nature, large mushrooms grow densely from glowing blue grass. Tough 'mycanoids' defend the area.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_StardustPillar: A blue lunar seal protected by powerful guardians. This one representing a glittering celestial remnant known as 'stardust'.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Jungle: Thick trees, brambled vines, and relentless beasts of nature inhabit this dense canopy of lush growth, sprouted from seemingly limitless mud.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Caverns: Tough monsters, abandoned cabins, and golden treasure adorn the dark, vacant caverns tunneled beneath the underground.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_UndergroundSnow: Tunnels carved throughout frigid ice result in slippery pitfalls and freezing pools - all patrolled by the sub-zero denizens of the deep.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Ocean: An endless ocean stretched to the horizon awaits at the world's edge, filled with infinitely hungry creatures from the watery depths.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_SurfaceMushroom: Surface mushroom patches must be cultivated by hand, but doing so may draw attention from strong mycanoids.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_UndergroundDesert: Beneath the sandy surface lies weathered, hard sandstone.  Massive nests of deadly insects and more infest these ancient burrows.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Snow: A persistent arctic jet stream left a part of the world permanently cold. Only the hardiest of beasts can survive this harsh region.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Desert: Endless dunes of sand reside here, scorched by the never-ending sun. Few things have adapted to survive in this environment.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Meteor: The fragments left behind from plummeting meteorites burn endlessly with astrological energy, some of which appears to be alive.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Oasis: This is no mirage! The clandestine pools of water glittering in the desert sun are the only source of life in these desolate sands.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_SpiderNest: In this deadly place, there lurk arachnids with many legs, many eyes, and a thirst for blood. They sow thick webs threaded with malice.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Crimson: A hive mind of grotesque, biological infections which aim to consume all life whilst feeling absolutely nothing.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_SolarPillar: A red lunar seal protected by powerful guardians. This one representing a flaming celestial event known as 'solar flares'.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_VortexPillar: A green lunar seal protected by powerful guardians. This one representing a deep celestial void known as 'vortex'.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_TheTemple: Stone-crafted with an ancient mineral alloy, this indomitable temple houses the Lihzahrd; a crude, yet advanced reptilian race.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_UndergroundCorruption: With the ancient spirits of light and dark released, the Corruption's reach drastically increased and its minions greatly empowered.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_NebulaPillar: A purple lunar seal protected by powerful guardians. This one representing a stormy celestial body known as 'nebula'.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_CorruptUndergroundDesert: The Corruption's hold in the sandstone weakened the seals that held an assortment of ancient magicked beings at bay.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_CrimsonUndergroundDesert: The Crimson's bloody veins broke up the tombs that once held magicked beings, which are now released to commit mayhem.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_HallowUndergroundDesert: The blessing swept through the ancient sands, awakening dangerous creatures once forgotten to time.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_CorruptDesert: When the Corruption grows through the desert, vile things long since buried in the sand awaken with pure malice.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_HallowDesert: As the Hallow responds to the encroaching evils, it inadvertently awakens things that have slept beneath the sands for centuries.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_CrimsonDesert: With the Crimson seeping through the sands, dark things long forgotten rise again to seek out and destroy life.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Granite: A glistening, dark material adorns the caverns here. Granite paves the way for progress in architectural fashion and durable monsters.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_UndergroundCrimson: With the ancient spirit of darkness released, the Crimson's veiny growth reaches new depths, and its macabre fiends gain strength.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_UndergroundHallow: With the evils now unleashed into the depths of the world, the Hallow fights back with powerful minions of light.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Marble: A smooth material wrought with pleasing veins of color coat the walls of this cavern. An ancient civilization of monsters dwell here.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_CorruptIce: Cold ice infused with even colder Corruption results in bitterly-frozen terrors lurking beneath the treacherous icy caverns.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_HallowIce: Ice serves as a catalyst for the blessing, the Hallow's luminous source of power. Strong entities take advantage of this light.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_CrimsonIce: These bitterly cold caverns of ice, saturated with the blood of Crimson, host a new variety of menacing frozen fiends.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_Sky: It is rumored that there is a land far above the clouds, where ancient treasures are guarded by powerful winged creatures.
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_DayTime: After 4:30am, the sun rises in the sky and the most dangerous of beings flee from the light. It's a great time to explore!
Bestiary_BiomeText.biome_NightTime: After 7:30pm, the moon rises in the sky. All manner of evil things, living and dead, roam the lands in the dark.

CommonBestiaryFlavor.Slime: A simple, gelatinous creature that swallows anything and everything whole! It takes a long time to digest anything.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.DemonEye: That suspicious feeling of being watched may very well come true in the dark of night, when Cthulhu's minions roam the skies.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Hornet: Aggressive flying insects which swarm the jungle depths. Their venomous barbs discharge over great distances at high velocity.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Zombie: Leaving doors open may be an invitation for shambling brain-eaters to enter the home, and nobody likes that.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Skeleton: Who needs muscles, skin, or even eyeballs? Skeletons get by with just the bones on their back, just as deadly as more fleshy foes.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.GoldCritter: Rarely, critters are found coated entirely in gold! Shopkeepers will pay handsomely for these, or you can show them off in cages!
CommonBestiaryFlavor.GoldBaitCritter: Rarely, critters are found coated entirely in gold! They are worth great coin to shopkeepers and fish absolutely love golden bait!
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Jellyfish: That strange tingling sensation in the water may be the unwelcome surging of electrical death from a brainless jellyfish. Swim with care.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Pigron: This elusive dragon-pig hybrid has excellent stealth capabilities despite its rotund figure. It is uncertain how they came to exist.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Dragonfly: A swift-flying insect which hunts mosquitoes. Comes in a variety of colors. Fish are somewhat attracted to these.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Mimic: Talking to a chest doesn't cause craziness, but if the chest answers back, it may cause death! It still contains rare treasure, regardless!
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Penguin: Penguins make their home in the coldest regions of the world, waddling around looking for tasty fish.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.LavaBat: What's worse than a rabid, fast-flying, and annoying flying rodent? One that is on fire, of course!
CommonBestiaryFlavor.AngryBones: Cursed with undeath, the former inhabitants of the Dungeon roam endlessly through its halls, seeking a victim for their unending fury.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.RustyArmoredBones: Through use and neglect, the Rusted Company's weapons are jagged and rough, inflicting terrible bleeding wounds upon their foes.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.BlueArmoredBones: Disciplined and relentless, the Marching Bones unceasingly pursue their goals, sundering anything, or anyone, in their way.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.HellArmoredBones: The fiery glow of the Molten Legion is unmistakable. With their red-hot armaments in hand, they blaze a trail through all those in their way.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.RaggedCaster: With their cursed magic, the members of the Ragged Brotherhood leave their victims helplessly lost in utter darkness.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Necromancer: In life, these sorcerers bore the Necromantic Sign of their order, and they shall continue to do so forever . . . even in death.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Diabolist: The undead who bear the Diabolic Sigil wield flames as intense as any in the underworld, consuming all in a scorching inferno.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.MushroomZombie: The fungus controlling the minds of these zombies wants only one thing: brains! This is very convenient for the zombie.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.CostumeDemonEye: No one knows who dressed these demon eyes up in cute costumes, but the whole process hasn't made them any friendlier.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.CostumeZombie: Wearing costumes isn't fooling anyone; these zombies are clearly way too old to be trick or treating.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.CostumeSkeleton: Skeletons need to wear very elaborate costumes during Halloween, or else people think they are dressing up as skeletons.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.ZombieXmas: Even zombies can celebrate the holidays. Their festive outfits are just right, but their holiday spirit could use some work.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.RibbonSlime: A perfectly gift wrapped bundle of slime. A wonderfully deadly present for any festive occasion.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.ZombieElf: Elves that used to work for Santa, but have since been zombified. They don't complain much, so they are still pretty good helpers.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.AntlionCharger: The soldiers of the antlion species, Antlion Chargers ferociously chase after intruders with a surprising speed.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.AntlionSwarmer: Antlion Swarmers patrol their nests with a watchful eye. Should anyone threaten their eggs, they will defend them fiercely.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Scarecrow: Possessed by vengeful spirits of the harvest, these scarecrows are out to cause mischief and mayhem galore.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.FungiBulb: When the glowing fungus is ready to spread, these bulbs will sprout to spread its spores to other locations and hosts.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Mummy: With the sands transmogrified by outside forces, those put to rest in the desert, whether good or evil, now rise to maim and kill.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Sandshark: In ancient times, a saltwater river once ran through the desert. These powerful creatures evolved to survive in the now dry sand.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.Lamia: By the time glowing red eyes appear in the darkness of the desert caves, it is already too late. The lamias have found their prey.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.GemSquirrel: Glistening squirrels who strayed too deep become ensorcelled with residual cursed energy retained in gemstones.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.GemBunny: These colorful rabbits made their way so deep, their reaction to magicked gems resulted in a coveted sparkling appearance.
CommonBestiaryFlavor.TownSlime: Where did these sentient slimes come from? It is a secret to everybody, but they are certainly oozing with personality!

Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BabySlime: Clinging tightly to their parents and rarely seen, these miniature slimes will swarm anyone who harms their mother.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MotherSlime: Critical to the lifecycle of the slime species, these oversized jiggling masses are often found carrying their young deep underground.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Pinky: The smallest slime ever recorded, their extreme cellular density makes them incredibly durable for their small size. They eat money.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Slimeling: The still-animate severed pieces of an injured Corrupt Slime, Slimelings can still put up a fight, and have strength in numbers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_EyeofCthulhu: A piece of Cthulhu ripped from his body centuries ago in a bloody war. It wanders the night seeking its host body... and revenge!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ServantofCthulhu: Young Demon Eyes newly birthed from the Eye of Cthulhu, brought forth to protect their master by any means necessary.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_EaterofSouls: Birthed from the Corruption as a being of pure malice, its sole instincts are to pursue, punish, and kill.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DevourerHead: Worm-like monstrosities are the Corruption's most favored creatures, tunneling underneath unsuspecting victims.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GiantWormHead: These itty bitty diggy dawgs dig through the earth and take focused spelunkers by surprise, causing unwanted distress.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_EaterofWorldsHead: Conceived from the bottomless malice of the Corruption, this mighty abyssal worm tunnels wildly to devour all in its path.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Merchant: The Merchant acts as a simple general store of sorts, providing useful starter tools and supplies needed for exploration.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Nurse: The Nurse's snarky attitude and poor bedside manner may be scary, but for a price, she will cure all that ails a wounded Terrarian.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ArmsDealer: The Arms Dealer has everything anyone could need to shoot things dead, from little round bullets to guns made from sharks.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Dryad: The Dryad is the last of her kind. She is connected with nature and can analyze its purity worldwide. She sells seeds, too!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Guide: The Guide always offers useful advice and crafting recipes. His origins and unusual connections to this world remain a mystery.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MeteorHead: When meteorites strike the surface, their fragments lay scattered for the taking. Some pieces are alive, and will attack.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_FireImp: A lesser demon imbued with hell magic. Capable of teleporting and hurling phantom fireballs towards their foes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GoblinPeon: Common footsoldiers of the Goblin Army, these foul creatures are good for little more than cannon fodder... and breaking down doors.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GoblinThief: Quick strike units of the Goblin Army, these pesky foes specialize in nimble movement and close-quarters combat.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GoblinWarrior: The backbone of the Goblin Army infantry, these heavily-armored soldiers can take tremendous damage as they march undeterred.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GoblinSorcerer: As primitive as they are, some goblins have the potential for manipulating magicked shadow energy through a form of hexing.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DarkCaster: Doomed to watch over the Dungeon, these mages teleport to confuse their prey, before striking them down with a blast of water.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CursedSkull: Exposed to dark rituals, this skull has begun floating around on its own, chasing the living. Its touch leaves its victims defenseless.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SkeletronHead: The disembodied bones of a former tyrant pulsed with a hatred so strong, it left behind a mighty curse which guards the Dungeon.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_OldMan: This hapless Old Man carries the burden of a heavy curse. It's said at night he transforms into a horrific demon which guards the Dungeon.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Demolitionist: Tread carefully around this dwarf. The Demolitionist is an explosive fanatic and sells dangerous things that go 'Boom!'
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BoneSerpentHead: Mighty serpentine dragons once ruled hell, but long ago shed their obsidian scales. A skeletal husk is all that remains.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ManEater: A sharp-toothed plant with a taste for human flesh. It has the ability to hide inside the mud and reach over great distances.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_UndeadMiner: There's evidence of spelunkers having explored the caverns in the past... as well as evidence of them having died doing so.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Tim: An enchanter in life, this funny fellow won't give up his robe or wizard hat without a fight. He prefers warmer caverns.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Bunny: Fuzzy wuzzy creatures that prefer safe, friendly locations.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CorruptBunny: Bunnies are pure beings that normally resist all forms of Corruption, but will succumb under the effects of a Blood Moon.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Harpy: Winged, demi-human women defend their territory against invaders by impaling them with their razor-sharp feathers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CaveBat: They are small, hard to see, and swiftly flap about in unpredictable ways. They often carry diseases, such as rabies.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_KingSlime: Slimes normally aren't intelligent, but occasionally they merge together to become a powerful force to swallow all things.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_JungleBat: These small, annoying creatures aren't to be underestimated. A deadly end awaits for those swarmed by these fangy rodents.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DoctorBones: This particular zombie has a knack for finding historical artifacts, but has a terrible disdain towards snakes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TheGroom: Tall, handsome, and dead. This unlucky fellow did not survive his wedding and is ready to take it out on everyone.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Clothier: Once trapped under a curse, the Clothier is the master of thread. If it's fashion that's desired, he's the man! He talks in a familiar way.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Goldfish: A seemingly ordinary goldfish, until it decides to rain.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Snatcher: A sharp-toothed plant with a taste for human flesh. It has the ability to hide inside the mud and reach over great distances.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CorruptGoldfish: Goldfish mutate and become violent when exposed to a Blood Moon, allowing the Corruption to take hold of them.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Piranha: Just one of these sharp-toothed fish can easily end a life. Luckily, they tend to swarm their victims in large groups! Life is grand.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LavaSlime: Due to the heat of the underworld, these slimes have taken on the properties of lava. Slaying them is difficult and dangerous.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Vulture: Built to survive the desert heat, avian scavengers such as these will peck apart those who come near their carrion.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Demon: Demons are the infantry of the underworld. Unlike their lesser brothers, they cast shadow magic rather than hell magic.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Shark: Once these ocean predators catch a whiff of blood, they become relentless and unstoppable in their ravenous pursuit.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_VoodooDemon: Higher ranking demons can possess a voodoo doll of the chosen one, whose soul is linked with the world's guardian himself.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Crab: This hard shelled coastal creature could snip the toes right off a man, among other things. They are not to be trifled with.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DungeonGuardian: A lethal sentry that stands watch over the Dungeon's gates. Those who are deemed unworthy to enter shall not pass!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Antlion: When antlions are nesting, they hide in the surface. To defend their eggs, they projectile vomit hard globs of sand at trespassers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DungeonSlime: Slimes in the Dungeon became powerful by feeding off the cursed energy throughout the place. They seem particularly attracted to keys.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GoblinScout: The Goblin Army sends lone soldiers out from the beaches to seek out colonies to conquer. They give warning with a tattered sigil.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Bird: A simple white bird which enjoys a calm sunny day.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Pixie: A larger, more luminous form of fairy. Pixies provide the Hallow with more blessed light and aid in the cleansing of the land.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ArmoredSkeleton: Remnants of a long lost expeditionary force, these stout warriors mindlessly patrol the caves in which they died.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CorruptSlime: Steeped in the power of Corruption, these slimes can survive being cut apart into smaller pieces, unlike their untainted brethren.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Wraith: Souls belonging to the darkest of hearts were once sealed in the world's core. Now, they roam the night to add to their kind.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CursedHammer: Magicked through the pure hatred of the Corruption, this weapon flails about attempting to smash anything that breathes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_EnchantedSword: Animated by the blessed light of the crystals, it will slice through anything to cleanse the world's evils.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Unicorn: These majestic single-horned equines storm angrily through the hallowed land in search of lowly intrusions needing to be cleansed away.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_WyvernHead: A colossal dragon-like creature unleashed along with the ancient spirits. It rules the skies with its unrivaled might.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GiantBat: The oversized cousins of Cave Bats, these bats are more dangerous and can confuse their enemies with their bite.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Corruptor: Like a cancer, the putrid creatures born from the Corruption mutate and grow into bigger, more deadly forms which discharge acids.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DiggerHead: Exposure to the effects of ancient magicks flowing throughout the cracks of the world causes unusual rapid growths in giant worms.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SeekerHead: Ancient magicks have unleashed the dark influences that gave birth to the Eater of Worlds, producing smaller, but just as deadly worms.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Clinger: In the depths of the darkest corruption lies cursed-fire belching, betentacled nightmares stretching from the very walls themselves.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_AnglerFish: Some angler fish are content to lie in wait for their prey, but these are perfectly happy to aggressively chase down an underwater meal.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Werewolf: Cursed by the moonlight, these menacing lupines were once human. Now, they feast on their loved ones instinctively.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GoblinTinkerer: Exiled from the rest of goblinkind for being an intelligent pacifist, the Tinkerer sells tools for combining accessories into stronger versions.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Wizard: The Wizard is an absent-minded, demented old man who dabbles in the arcane arts. He sells magical trinkets to train new apprentices.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Clown: His origins unknown, this creepy fiend balances himself on a ball while hurling explosive destruction at everything around him.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SkeletonArcher: Skeleton Archers have a keen eye, despite the general lack of eyes. Distance offers little protection from their blazing arrows.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GoblinArcher: Lending ranged support to the Goblin Army, archers keep a distance and pick off distracted and overwhelmed foes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_WallofFlesh: Serving as the world's core and guardian, the towering demon lord exists to keep powerful ancient spirits sealed away.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TheHungry: The Wall of Flesh's many mouths, attached by bloody veins. As a last resort, they can tear away and hungrily chase down threats.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TheHungryII: The Wall of Flesh's many mouths, attached by bloody veins. As a last resort, they can tear away and hungrily chase down threats.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LeechHead: A worm-like parasite spit forth from the Wall of Flesh, filled with the lifeblood of its host. This blood has healing properties.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ChaosElemental: Once living beings infused by the blessing, they erratically make chase with an uncontrollable surge of luminous power.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Slimer: The Slimer has become airborne with wings of unknown origin. The wings are easily knocked off with force, depriving it of its flight.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Gastropod: Touched by the blessing, these nocturnal slimes evolved into a levitating snail-like creature which spits powerful beams of light.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Mechanic: The Mechanic was imprisoned for her aptitude in engineering. She sells wiring and tools for putting together anything imaginable.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Retinazer: Belonging to a pair of mechanically recreated Eyes of Cthulhu, this one focuses its energy into firing powerful lasers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Spazmatism: Belonging to a pair of mechanically recreated Eyes of Cthulhu, this one chases at high speed, exhaling cursed flames.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SkeletronPrime: Mechanically reconstructed for reviving Cthulhu, this Skeletron has more arms than ever before, and a variety of fierce weapons.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_WanderingEye: Given time to mature, Demon Eyes will continue to grow in size and danger. These ones are old enough that their teeth have come in.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TheDestroyer: A mechanical simulacrum of Cthulhu's spine decorated in laser-armed probes, which detach from its body when damaged.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IlluminantBat: Blessed with the prismatic light of the Hallow, the Illuminant Bats are a vibrant pink blur arcing across the darkness of the Underground.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IlluminantSlime: Slimes exposed to the light of the Hallow's crystals begin to emit that very same light, glowing brightly in the darkness.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Probe: A singular probe detached from the Destroyer's body serves as a remote laser battery, often in a swarm of other probes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PossessedArmor: Whatever possessed this suit of armor to suddenly walk about and start killing everyone? It lacks a corporeal body.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ToxicSludge: Distantly related to the common slime, the Toxic Sludge takes down its prey with potent toxins and a disarmingly toothy smile.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SantaClaus: Only present during a specific time of year, Santa Claus makes a big entrance and an even bigger, rather explosive exit. Ho! Ho! Ho!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SnowmanGangsta: While the world's inhabitants celebrate festivities, gangster snowmen party by slaying everyone with their tommy guns.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MisterStabby: This stone-cold, yet maniacal gangster never snuffs the celebrating do-gooders without bringing along his 'Lil' Pokey'.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SnowBalla: Nobody underestimates the throwing arm on this disturbed member of the snowman mafioso. He's a real slugger!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IceSlime: Slimes that spent too long in arctic temperatures may begin to partially freeze, developing a shifting layer of ice on their surface.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IceBat: As if bats weren't enough of a nuisance already, Ice Bats can freeze flesh solid with a touch, leaving their prey defenseless.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GiantFlyingFox: An oversized cousin of the bat found only in the Jungle, giant flying foxes hunt the night skies looking for prey.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GiantTortoise: No one takes the giant tortoises seriously. Not until they come hurtling through the air, a spinning, spiky ball of death.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IceTortoise: Like their jungle cousins, ice tortoises are an unexpectedly serious threat, possessing surprising speed and mobility.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Wolf: Living in the harshest of climates, these savage lupines hunt in the dark of night desperately for sustenance.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_RedDevil: Conjuring potent spears of dark magic, these elite demons are a serious threat to any who dare enter their abode.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Arapaima: These enormous fish thrive in the jungle waters near veins of unstable magicks, which make them unusually strong and hostile.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Vampire: Whether he is a man who turns into a bat, or a bat who turns into a man, one thing is for sure: he's out for blood!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Truffle: Harnessing the hidden power of the glowing mushroom, the Truffle forges weapons and tools exclusively in his mushroom home.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ZombieEskimo: Zombies found in snow biomes are often found bundled up in winter clothing. It doesn't help them any, they are still dead cold!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Frankenstein: Built from parts of deceased Terrarians, this stout monster resulted from a crazy man's desire to create life with his own hands.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_WallCreeperWall: They have eight legs, eight eyes, and eight ways to cocoon and feast upon an unsuspecting victim.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SwampThing: Creeping from the depths of the darkest swamps, this algae-dripped beast desires to drown away anyone in his path.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_UndeadViking: Long before there were pirates, stories tell of powerful vikings who raged the seas. Their remains roam the icy caverns below.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CorruptPenguin: During a Blood Moon, the normally docile penguins fall under the hostile influence of the Corruption.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IceElemental: Water elementals become icy when dense strong magicks accumulate in the coldest places. Their frosty shards freeze all.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_RuneWizard: Tim's more powerful and much better-looking older brother. He, too, prefers the heat, but not excessively.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Crimera: The most common horror to be born from the Crimson, it seeks to consume pure things with unrelenting hunger.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Herpling: These hyper, demented, slug-like fiends serve the crimson horde with an unstoppable appetite for blood and flesh.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_AngryTrapper: When a Man Eater consumes enough human flesh, it undergoes a cocoon-like metamorphosis into a far deadlier form.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MossHornet: The empowered flora of the Jungle has merged with these species of Hornet, strengthening their exoskeletons and stingers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Derpling: These large, sapphire-shelled fleas leap around incessantly. They can drain the blood content of one man within seconds.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Steampunker: The Steampunker has a particular taste for steam-fueled machinery and gadgets. She sells her gizmos with an endearing accent.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CrimsonAxe: Ensorcelled by the Crimson collective, this weapon moves about and chops its enemies by its own will.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_FaceMonster: It would be unwise to face off with one of these unfeeling, hungry mutations. Their mouths are large enough to devour all things.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_FloatyGross: These buoyant terrors of the darkest crimson depths most definitely, without question, are both floaty and gross.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Crimslime: Taking on the consistency of congealed blood and flesh, Crimslimes seek out and digest more raw material for the Crimson.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SpikedIceSlime: This Ice Slime has large ice shards in its mass from excessive exposure to the cold. Somehow, it is able to launch these at its prey.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SnowFlinx: A strange, round furry mammal with an unusually large, protruding nose. They are extremely lightweight.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SlimedZombie: Sometimes, a slime's victim will turn into a zombie mid-digestion. Walking around like that is quite awkward for both parties.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LostGirl: Naked and afraid, this girl stands still, deep in the world, as if waiting for someone to rescue her and lead her to the surface.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Nymph: Masterfully deceives explorers by posing as a lost girl, then attacks with ferocious might, blood-lust in her eyes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ArmoredViking: The most elite vikings were worthy of the strongest armor. It seems that it wasn't terribly effective, given their state now.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Lihzahrd: A reclusive race of reptilian folk found exclusively in the mysterious jungle Temple. They look primitive, but are quite advanced.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SpikedJungleSlime: Frequent consumption of the Jungle's toxins and thorns has resulted in a slime covered in venomous spikes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Moth: Rarely, exposure to jungle toxins causes certain moths to mutate to enormous size. They release a valuable dust on death.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IcyMerman: Mermen rarely stray far from the ocean. Those that do can become lost, wander into cold caverns, and become icy undead fish men.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DyeTrader: Eccentric and rather snobby to a fault, the Dye Trader has expensive tastes. He is passionate about the materials used in the dyes he sells.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PartyGirl: Positive beyond comprehension, the Party Girl will use any excuse to celebrate. She sells party favors and flashy things.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Cyborg: The Cyborg was built with the combined efforts of the Mechanic and the Steampunker to aid in rocket science and world defense.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Bee: Found in hives and nests all throughout the jungle, these tiny pests will swarm an adventurer at every turn.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BeeSmall: Found in hives and nests all throughout the jungle, these tiny pests will swarm an adventurer at every turn.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PirateDeckhand: They are either washing the deck of their ship of seaweed and ale, or wiping the dirt with the faces of unsuspecting Terrarians.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PirateCorsair: Once mercenaries from a distant land, Corsairs brandish deadly scimitars with unyielding skill and a cut-throat agenda.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PirateDeadeye: Nobody knows if 'Dead Eye' refers to their precise aim, or the fact that one of their eyes is indeed 'dead'... like their targets.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PirateCrossbower: Some wee lasses aren't content staying at port waiting for their men to return from a raid, so they join in on the deadly fun!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PirateCaptain: A pirate captain's love for riches is only rivaled by his obsession with heavy gunpowder and large, rampart-shattering cannons!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CochinealBeetle: Found in deep, dark caverns, these large beetles are sought out for the deep, blood-red secretions stored in their scaly exoskeleton.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CyanBeetle: Hardy to extremely cold temperatures, these beetles contain a desired bluish fluid which can be used to dye textiles.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LacBeetle: These scaly insects thrive in thick subterranean foliage. Their secretions stain many materials in a beautiful violet color.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SeaSnail: This unusually large snail makes its home deep in the ocean. Its mucus can be manufactured into a purple dye.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Squid: A betentacled marine creature which discharges a thick, black ink when threatened. The ink is collected for aesthetic purposes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_QueenBee: This highly aggressive monstrosity responds violently when her larva is disturbed; the honey-laden hives are her home turf.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ZombieRaincoat: Some zombies never leave home without their trusty raincoat. Comfy and dry, they pursue human flesh no matter the weather.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_FlyingFish: Certain species of fish gain the most peculiar abilities when it rains. They only like one thing about land-dwellers: their flesh.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_UmbrellaSlime: The previous owner of this umbrella learned the hard way: umbrellas are good protection against rain, but not against slime.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_FlyingSnake: Kept as pets and guardians by the Lihzahrd race, the flying snakes will attack any who trespass on the Temple's protected grounds.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Painter: The Painter can talk about all the different shades of colors with which one can paint the walls. He'll sell but a handful of them!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_WitchDoctor: It's unusual for a Lihzahrd to be outside the Temple. Even more unusual are the voodoo things he sells. He prefers his jungle digs.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Pirate: Ahoy! The only good Pirate Captain is... one that sells cannons and weapons to take out all competing Pirate Captains!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_JungleCreeperWall: The itsy bitsy spider climbed up a jungle vine, down came a hapless explorer and the spider got to dine. The End.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BlackRecluseWall: They have eight legs, eight eyes, and eight ways to cocoon and feast upon an unsuspecting victim.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BloodCrawlerWall: Most spiders operate independently, but ones touched by the Crimson hive coordinate together to consume life.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BloodFeeder: Like the piranha, these swarming fish thirst for blood. Birthed from tainted blood themselves, their hunger is truly intense.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BloodJelly: Jellyfish swimming in the bloody waters of the Crimson become infected, converting them to its all-consuming cause.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IceGolem: Sub-zero temperatures, blinding snow flurries, and being blasted apart by an icy construct are some of the dangers of blizzards.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_RainbowSlime: These blessing-infused gelatin menaces glow vibrantly in a rainbow of hues. As a result, they require a constant liquid intake.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Golem: A remarkable display of ingenuity constructed by the Lihzahrd clan. Powered by solar energy cells, it is ready to guard the Temple.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_AngryNimbus: When severe storms roll through, it is said that the skies are angry. This cloud in particular is especially livid!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Eyezor: A powerful zombie-like creature whose eye can see for miles, and blow away opponents with powerful lasers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Parrot: A pirate's best friend, the parrot, will tear the eyes out of any greasy landlubber with its sharp, pointy talons.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Reaper: The reaper's list stretches endlessly with the names of those who will soon depart this world. His sickle will make sure of that.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_FungoFish: Some fish exposed to glowing mushroom spores become a curious mushroom-jellyfish hybrid, glowing softly in the watery depths.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_AnomuraFungus: These crab-like creatures scuttle about in glowing mushroom fields, heavily infested by the fungal spores.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MushiLadybug: This aggressive species of ladybug is quite at home near glowing mushrooms, living symbiotically with the fungus.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Plantera: A dormant, yet powerful floral guardian awoken by the fallout of Cthulhu's destroyed machinations. Its reach spans the entire jungle.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BrainofCthulhu: A piece of Cthulhu torn asunder, this vile mastermind pulses with agony and aids the Crimson in an attempt to avenge its master.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Creeper: Manipulated through the hive mind of the Crimson, Creepers serve as the brain's eyes and orbit around it for defense in numbers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IchorSticker: Filled to the brim with powerful ichor, these squid-like abominations spew their corrosive bio-fluid at their prey.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BoneLee: It's said that centuries ago, there was once a clan of ninjas that hid in the shadows of the world. It seems they are long dead now.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DungeonSpirit: Sometimes, highly concentrated ectoplasm gathers inside the more powerful of the cursed inhabitants of the Dungeon.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GiantCursedSkull: No one knows where these giant skulls came from, but like their smaller cousins, they seek out and curse the living with their magic.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Paladin: In distant history, these mighty undead knights once guarded a prosperous city before a massive curse befell them.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SkeletonSniper: These eagle-eyed sharpshooters let nothing escape their crosshairs. Part of an elite military unit in their past lives.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TacticalSkeleton: With thick armor and mighty boomsticks, it's clear these bones are prepared for a siege. Part of an elite military unit in their past lives.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SkeletonCommando: Rocket-powered and fueled with rage, these cursed skeletons prefer the nuclear option. Part of an elite military unit in their past lives.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BirdBlue: This little blue bird came looking for worms.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BirdRed: A rare, red-crested friend of the forest.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Squirrel: Fast moving and erratic woodland creatures with grayish-brown fur. Got nuts?
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Mouse: Mice squeak around harmlessly, looking for small insects in damp underground locations.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Raven: Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SlimeMasked: Is it a slime in a bunny costume? Or is it a bunny in a slime costume? Halloween can be very confusing sometimes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BunnySlimed: Is it a bunny in a slime costume? Or is it a slime in a bunny costume? Halloween can be very confusing sometimes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_HoppinJack: This particular pumpkin seeks revenge for being carved. His hearty leaps become quicker the more he is carved into.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_HeadlessHorseman: This menacing nightmare rides out into the night to harvest living souls on his seeing-eye horse, for he has no head of his own.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Ghost: During the most harrowing times, these apparitions float aimlessly through the depths to steal the life from those they envy.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MourningWood: These enormous murder trees nightmarishly stomp about, prepared to shower endless fiery destruction upon all life.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Splinterling: Mourning Woods reproduce by snapping cuttings from their bodies and thrusting them into the soil. Splinterlings are the result.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Pumpking: A pumpkin has many faces. A pumpkin will murder all with many sharp blades. A pumpkin is king of the harvest.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Hellhound: Most certainly not a good boy, this vicious demon dog is more than eager to guide living beings to the underworld with every bite.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Poltergeist: The intense hateful energies emanating from these spirits grant them the ability to move objects, truly for the purpose of killing.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BunnyXmas: Judging by the outfit, Santa appears to have recruited some bunnies to be his little helpers this year.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PresentMimic: Surprise! The most unexpected gift this holiday season, the Present Mimic is a nicely gift-wrapped box of teeth and death.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GingerbreadMan: A gingerbread man seeking vengeance for his long-eaten brethren. He may look yummy, but this is one tough cookie.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Yeti: An ill-tempered ape from cold, snowy regions to the north. They do not appreciate festivity, so they've come to spoil all the fun.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Everscream: If trees could scream, this evil evergreen would do so constantly. Deadly are the ornaments hurled from its branches.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_IceQueen: If this icy towering monstrosity wishes for someone's soul, they'll surely let it go... right from their cold, dead hands.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SantaNK1: This jolly bad boy wants to stuff everyone's stockings with the gift of their entrails. This cranky Kringle's gone postal.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ElfCopter: The elves aren't just flying toy helicopters, these are fully combat ready. All that inventing finally paid off!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_NutcrackerSpinning: Bringing his massive chompers to bear, the Nutcracker frolics through the wintery night. Nuts aren't the only thing he can crack.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ElfArcher: These aren't your typical elven archers. Tinkering all year long, they are excited to gift you with the hottest new arrows this season.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Krampus: Every year, Krampus is tasked to punish all of the naughty children, but he's taken the day off to participate in this mayhem instead!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Flocko: These ferocious flakes are the frozen minions of the Ice Queen. Where this sinister snow falls, so shall her icy judgment.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Stylist: The Stylist loves style, gossip, and hair. Aside from performing a miracle makeover, she sells some hair product as well.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Firefly: Appears at night in calm locations, illuminating the sky with strobing green light. Fish are fairly attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Butterfly: Beautiful fluttering insects that love sunrises. Fish are attracted to these based on their color variety.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Worm: A slick, tubular invertebrate found hiding in rocks, dirt, and grass. Loves the rain. Fish are especially attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LightningBug: Appears at night in blessed locations, filling the sky with flashing cyan light. Fish are especially attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Snail: A slimy mollusk that thrives in damp, dark places. Fish are barely attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GlowingSnail: A snail that has mutated to adapt to the glowing mushroom environment. Fish are significantly attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Frog: Prefers bodies of water filled with thick growth. Perfectly content both on land and underwater.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Duck: A water fowl with beautiful plumage. Swims in the purest of water, quacking happily.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DuckWhite: A white feathered waterfowl that swims in pure water and basks in the warm sun.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ScorpionBlack: Despite its menacing appearance, it is quite docile unless threatened or facing smaller prey. Fish are occasionally attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Scorpion: Harmlessly scuttles around the desert looking for food. Fish are barely attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TravellingMerchant: The flamboyantly-dressed Traveling Merchant travels far and wide to bring unique, cultural wares from time to time.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Angler: The Angler, a rude fishing genius, sends others to find weird, rare fish. He rewards random items, entertained by any misfortunes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DukeFishron: An aquatic pigron mutation from the depths of the ocean who surfaces in search of a rare, savory type of worm.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Sharkron: Duke Fishron's nature as a form of chimera causes his offspring to emerge more shark-like, which he uses as minions in battle.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TruffleWorm: An extremely rare, difficult to catch glowworm. A specific, powerful sea creature is insatiably attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Grasshopper: It leaps tall blades of grass in a single bound. Fish are fairly attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ChatteringTeethBomb: A playful prank gone wrong, clowns will unleash these explosive chompers on their enemies. Also great for parties!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CultistArcherBlue: Sworn to protect the cultist's ritual, these robed archers will fight to the death defending the lunatic devotees.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BrainScrambler: These Martian soldiers brandish crude laser weaponry that releases dangerous short-range radiation, hence the protective helmets.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_RayGunner: The elite specialists in the Martian Invasion Force are equipped with more precise and deadly laser rifles; effectively snipers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MartianOfficer: Lacking offensive weaponry, officers in the Martian forces favor defensive measures to focus on relaying tactics to the soldiers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GrayGrunt: Martians are conscripted into military service, and those who do not make the cut are sent out unarmed to distract the enemy as fodder.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MartianEngineer: Martian soldiers who lack combat ability may instead be deployed for their mechanical aptitude, constructing turrets on the field.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MartianTurret: Named after a historic Terrarian, these turrets are built by Martian engineers and rain devastating energy upon anyone nearby.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MartianDrone: The data collected from these drones are sent back to the motherships moments before they self-destruct onto their foes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GigaZapper: Martians who show great potential in close combat are equipped with powerful energy spears that can atomize anything.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ScutlixRider: Elite Ray Gunners often ride these powerful alien creatures into battle as cavalry. If their mount dies, they will pursue on foot.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Scutlix: Native to the Martian homeworld, these creatures function similarly to horses. That is, if horses could fire lasers from their eyes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MartianSaucerCore: An advanced flying saucer from somewhere well beyond this world. The destruction from its weaponry is unimaginable.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MoonLordCore: The mastermind behind all terrors which befall the world, freed from his lunar prison. Practically a god, his power knows no limits.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MartianProbe: Sensing growing power on the planet, otherworldly beings send space-age technology to scan for advanced lifeforms.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_StardustWormHead: The celestial energies of which this worm is born give its body and tail near unstoppable power as it twists through the skies.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_StardustCellBig: A biological single-celled organism that divides and multiplies rapidly with the limitless power of celestial energy.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_StardustCellSmall: A biological single-celled organism that divides and multiplies rapidly with the limitless power of celestial energy.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_StardustJellyfishBig: A cosmic jellyfish-type creature infused with abundant celestial energies which summons smaller minions to serve as its weaponry.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_StardustSpiderBig: This beastly celestial arachnid rapidly spawns swift and relentless offspring to distract its prey as it prepares to devour them.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_StardustSoldier: This slow-moving celestial soldier fires cosmic rays at unsuspecting invaders, defending the pillar without hesitation.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SolarCrawltipedeHead: Wrapped in celestial energy, this worm-like creature seems invincible. Having no eyes, it seeks vibrations throughout the air.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SolarDrakomire: These celestial beasts harness the power of the sun, releasing violent flares towards any intruders nearing the pillar.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SolarDrakomireRider: Many drakanians ride the beastly Drakomires as a form of battle steed. Should the Drakomire be slain, they will pursue on foot.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SolarSroller: These humanoid celestial monsters assault their foes by rolling up into a ball and charging them with their sharp, fiery spikes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SolarCorite: Resembling a large, sentient meteorite, Corites are infused with celestial energy and will charge at anything that moves.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SolarSolenian: These acrobatic celestial warriors can deflect incoming threats whilst spinning with their solar-infused blades.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_NebulaBrain: These brain-like celestial beings have psionic capabilities, phasing through space and summoning powerful optical minions.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_NebulaHeadcrab: These psionic, squid-like beasts levitate with celestial energy and latch onto the head of their prey, disrupting brain functions.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LunarTowerVortex: Representing a deep celestial void known as 'vortex', this tower holds the seal locking away a terrifying tyrant.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_NebulaBeast: Celestial power fuels the aggression of these violent beasts, allowing them to run down those who trespass the pillar's area.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_NebulaSoldier: The cosmic power held by these humanoid warriors grant them psychic abilities, in which they use to accurately shoot down foes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_VortexRifleman: These alien soldiers carry a versatile arsenal of celestial rifles and cosmic accessories that allow them to defy gravity.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_VortexHornetQueen: The final evolutionary stage of the alien hornet. They fire powerful disruptive energy at their prey, and give birth to many larvae.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_VortexHornet: These flying insectoids utilize wormholes to ambush intruders near the celestial pillars. They hunt in pairs and may swiftly evolve.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_VortexLarva: The larval stage of the alien hornets. They may seem weak and harmless, but if ignored they will evolve into powerful beings.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_VortexSoldier: The cosmic energy surging through these warriors builds up until their untimely demise, resulting in an explosion of lightning.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CultistDevote: Utterly devoted, Lunatic Devotees unfailingly worship their deity, even when threatened with death. Fear only makes them worship harder.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CultistBoss: A fanatical leader hell-bent on bringing about the apocalypse by reviving the great Cthulhu through behind-the-scenes scheming.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CultistBossClone: Though it is an illusion designed to distract from the true threat, this fake cultist can still use some basic offensive magic as well.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TaxCollector: This grumpy Tax Collector has literally been to hell and back. Greedy to a fault, he's truly only concerned with money.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SkeletonMerchant: Most skeletons are out for blood, but not the Skeleton Merchant. He just wants to sell supplies, such as rare torches and yo-yo gear.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CultistDragonHead: Wyvern souls are entwined in the atmosphere of the world. Powerful magicks can summon them through the veil with physical form.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Butcher: Soulless and cruel, this pig-masked psychotic killer brandishes a powerful chainsaw in which to dismember every living thing.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CreatureFromTheDeep: Said to have emerged from the blackest lagoons, these fish-men lash at their victims with unmatched submerged mobility.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Fritz: Rumors speak of a small-minded hunchback who assisted in mad science. This small fellow reacts unpredictably when approached.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Nailhead: An intelligent being who seeks out souls to steal, utilizing nails from his own body both as a weapon and as defensive measures.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CrimsonBunny: Bunnies are pure beings that normally cannot be afflicted by Crimson, but will succumb under the effects of a Blood Moon.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CrimsonGoldfish: Goldfish become grotesque, blood-sucking fiends of the Crimson when exposed to a Blood Moon.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Psycho: This masked killer's quiet demeanor and cunning ability to hunt allows him to ambush his victims without being detected.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DeadlySphere: By means unknown, this silvery metamorphic sphere levitates about on its own. It moves about quickly, often producing spikes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DrManFly: Part man, part fly, all doctor. He's brought his most volatile and dangerous chemicals, and he's buzzing to try them out.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ThePossessed: A Terrarian girl possessed by the most evil of spirits, she gains superhuman abilities and behaves both arbitrarily and violently.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_CrimsonPenguin: During a Blood Moon, the normally docile penguins become infested with the contagious growth of the Crimson.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GoblinSummoner: Gifted in the darkest of magics, she conjures unfathomable shadowflame ghasts through a powerful hex.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ShadowFlameApparition: The shadowflame magicks are powerful spiritual remnants of twisted goblin ancestors, wrought from powerful summoning.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BigMimicCorruption: Mimics which fall to Corruption grow larger and more powerful as a result. They can be birthed from ordinary chests by force.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BigMimicCrimson: Mimics which are enthralled by the Crimson are empowered dramatically. They can be birthed from ordinary chests by force.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BigMimicHallow: Mimics struck with the blessing surge with energy and become powerful. They can be birthed from ordinary chests by force.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Mothron: A behemoth of an insect attracted to the eerie anti-glow of a solar eclipse. With a rapid gestation period, it multiplies quickly.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MothronSpawn: The creatures which burst from the eggs laid by mothron can be as deadly and as relentless as their daunting mothers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Medusa: An ancient monster with a petrifying gaze. The snakes which grow from her scalp like hair grant her these powers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GreekSkeleton: In the ruins of an ancient civilization now deeply buried, some of its spear-hurling soldiers still walk its marble-adorned paths.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GraniteGolem: Strong are the magicked spirits which inhabit the granite masses deep below, this type in particular taking on a humanoid shape.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GraniteFlyer: Earth elementals manifest through many forms by taking on the properties of different materials, such as this hardy granite.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_EnchantedNightcrawler: Worms infused with fallen star magic glow with a glittering light. Fish are extremely attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Grubby: Slimy, yet satisfying! Fish are somewhat attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Sluggy: Slow and covered in a slick mucus. Fish are especially attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Buggy: A vibrant beetle-like bug. Fish are extremely attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BloodZombie: With enough exposure to a Blood Moon, zombies become twisted and cursed with everflowing blood pouring out from their rotten flesh.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Drippler: Demon eyes become erratic under a Blood Moon, sometimes twisting together into a dripping cluster of cursed blood and eyeballs.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PirateShip: When the pirates face strong opposition in their pillaging raids, they bring their majestic floating galleon as backup. Cannons away!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LunarTowerStardust: Representing a glittering celestial remnant known as 'stardust', this tower holds the seal locking away a terrifying tyrant.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Crawdad: A subterranean form of crayfish which scuttles along the cavern floors, searching for prey to clip apart with its powerful pincers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GiantShelly: To overcome their slow speed, shellies have developed the ability to hide inside their spiked shell and hurl themselves at their foes.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Salamander2: An unusual amphibious bipedal lizard which inhabits the dark caverns. When threatened, it spews a highly corrosive acid everywhere.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LunarTowerNebula: Representing a stormy celestial body known as 'nebula', this tower holds the seal locking away a terrifying tyrant.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DuneSplicerHead: The world's largest, most deadly worm. Strengthened by ancient magicks, it can devour a spicy Terrarian quicker than they realize.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TombCrawlerHead: The desert is home to one of the largest varieties of worms across the land. It has a voracious appetite for careless explorers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LunarTowerSolar: Representing a flaming celestial event known as 'solar flares', this tower holds the seal locking away a terrifying tyrant.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SolarSpearman: These highly aggressive celestial soldiers carry a large, fiery spear that can melt nearly anything it penetrates.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MartianWalker: A wonder of Martian technology constructed from the strongest metals and infused with biological components.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_AncientCultistSquidhead: A vision of a deadly omen wrought forth by a powerful cultist, often appears with reckless cosmic summoning of wyvern spirits.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DesertGhoul: Wandering the dark caverns below the desert dunes, ghouls are the dessicated husks of zombies preserved by the arid environment.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DesertGhoulCorruption: Ghouls twisted by the Corruption ooze a nasty green bile that ignites on contact with skin, scorching their prey with cursed flames.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DesertGhoulCrimson: Ghouls infested by the Crimson leak vile ichor from their mouths, weakening the defenses of their foes with every bite.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DesertGhoulHallow: Ghouls cleansed by the Hallow possess a psychedelic saliva that renders their victims confused and distracted by visions and mirages.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DesertScorpionWall: These unnaturally large scorpions have adapted to swiftly pursuing their prey along the walls with their sharp, venomous tails.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DesertBeast: Sturdy as a rock, these lizard-like beasts roam the desert in search of food. Their hardened bodies make them formidable threats.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DesertDjinn: Ancient magicks corrupted the minds of the once friendly desert djinns, releasing them full of hostility from their lamps.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DemonTaxCollector: Sentenced to an eternity of punishment for his lifelong greedy ambitions, this man has long been corrupted into a demonic state.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TheBride: It's uncertain if the bride was wed before or after her death, but the story ends tragically for anyone who crosses her path.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SandSlime: Deserts are very dry, but the Sand Slime seems to have successfully adapted to the harsh conditions by becoming a pile of living sand.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SquirrelRed: Rare, red-furred hyperactive rodents which scurry about the woods.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_PartyBunny: Someone put a party hat on a bunny. It must be a real party animal.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SandElemental: The most intense sandstorms draw forth powerful earth elementals. With this feminine form, her tornadoes tear all asunder.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Tumbleweed: Powerful winds have blown this tumbleweed around the desert, and it is none too pleased. They roll faster with the wind than against it.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2Bartender: The Tavern Keep once managed a bar in another universe. He's here to help stop the Old One's Army from conquering this world.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2Betsy: A vicious Etherian dragon who leads the minions of the Old One's Army that found their way to this world.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2GoblinT3: A unique goblin species from Etheria, they are not related Terrarian goblins. The ferocious footsoldiers of the Old One's Army.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2GoblinBomberT3: Hurling bombs with reckless abandon, these sappers serve the Old One's Army with maniacal passion.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2WyvernT3: Etherian Wyverns come in a variety of shapes and sizes, and behave more like bats than the majestic Wyverns of this world.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2JavelinstT3: These bulky brutes are awkward and ungainly, but their javelins are still razor sharp, and their aim is deadly.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2DarkMageT1: A small, levitating sorcerer from Etheria who wields dark magic and can even raise fresh minions for the Old One's Army.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2DarkMageT3: A small, levitating sorcerer from Etheria who wields dark magic and can even raise fresh minions for the Old One's Army.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2SkeletonT3: Small armies of these skeletons are summoned from the ground by Dark Mages, loyally serving their master's will.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2WitherBeastT3: Wither beasts emit a defense-sapping aura from the crystals on their back. While rooted in place, they heal rapidly.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2DrakinT3: Etherian reptiles in service of the Old One's Army. Powerful beasts, they are capable of spewing deadly purple flames.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2KoboldWalkerT3: Rigged with an explosive payload, Kobolds have no regard for safety. They eagerly blow themselves up, hoping to take their foes with them.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2KoboldFlyerT3: Taking the explosive approach to a whole new level, Kobold Gliders soar the skies, seeking to bring death from above.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2OgreT2: A tall, hulking demi-human from the Old One's Army with unfathomable strength and vitality. He carries a big stick.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2OgreT3: A tall, hulking demi-human from the Old One's Army with unfathomable strength and vitality. He carries a big stick.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_DD2LightningBugT3: Lightning Bugs from Etheria aren't just named that for their pretty lights! These ones blast their foes with shocking bolts of electricity.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LarvaeAntlion: Freshly hatched from their eggs, larval antlions should not be underestimated. Though young, they are still very aggressive.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_FairyCritterPink: Glowing winged humanoid creatures the size of a butterfly. Attuned to the world around them, they excel at finding shiny things.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_FairyCritterGreen: Glowing winged humanoid creatures the size of a butterfly. Attuned to the world around them, they excel at finding shiny things.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_FairyCritterBlue: Glowing winged humanoid creatures the size of a butterfly. Attuned to the world around them, they excel at finding shiny things.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ZombieMerman: Mermen may be rare and exotic demi-humans, but they can still die... and still come back from that a changed merman.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_EyeballFlyingFish: For mysterious reasons, fish are known to mutate with other living things or even man-made objects. This one is especially violent.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Golfer: The Golfer is a wise, middle-aged man who sells all sorts of golfing equipment. He's got game and knows how to score.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TorchZombie: In life, this torch-wielding zombie joined an angry mob to hunt the undead. In death, it joined an undead mob to hunt the living.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_WindyBalloon: Some enterprising slimes ride wind currents with balloons in an effort to find food. Pop their balloons to bring them back down to earth.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Seagull: A larger bird that inhabits coastal areas. Watch out for droppings!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_LadyBug: A brilliant red insect often associated with luck. Fishing with these as bait may result in unwanted karma.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Maggot: An unsavory larval bug which feasts on dead, rotting matter. Fish are somewhat attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Pupfish: These fish prefer isolated, extreme climates where competition is scarce, such as the lakebeds of a desert oasis.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Grebe: An exotic waterfowl that thrives in the desert oasis.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Rat: These fuzzy rodents sniff about in putrid locations scavenging for food. They are avoided in fear of diseases they may carry.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Owl: A large, wise predatory bird which hunts nocturnally from the tree tops.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_WaterStrider: Glides elegantly along the surface of calm bodies of water searching for smaller bugs. Fish are occasionally attracted to these.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ExplosiveBunny: Not the typical garden-variety bunny. This one has been tampered with, and has an explosive temper as a result.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Dolphin: A playful sea mammal whose intelligence rivals that of humanity.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Turtle: These slow, stoic creatures travel between lakes and dry land, carrying a hard shell on their backs for protection.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TurtleJungle: Their hard shells camouflage them from vicious predators by blending in with the thick, jungly environment in which they reside.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BloodNautilus: An enormous shelled water demon which feeds off the negative energy of a Blood Moon. Brutally responds to being pestered.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BloodSquid: Summoned in small groups by the Nautilus to aid their master in battle. Thick are the streams of blood squirted from their bodies.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GoblinShark: Half-shark, half-goblin, completely murderous! One of the numerous reasons to just stay home during a Blood Moon.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BloodEelHead: A large, worm-like demon, dripping with blood - both its own, and its victim's. It's a bloody nightmare of a fiend!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Gnome: A tiny long-bearded sneak who resides in oversized trees. Becomes a lawn ornament when exposed to sunlight.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SeaTurtle: A soft-shelled reptile that prefers saltwater and marine prey.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Seahorse: A gentle critter which swims harmlessly in the ocean depths.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Dandelion: All this wind can make just about anyone angry. Evidently, this includes otherwise harmless dandelions and their deadly seeds.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_RockGolem: Dense-minded living stone formation. Awaits weary cavern dwellers to pound them into juicy rubble.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BloodMummy: The blood-dripping organic matter in these mummies display far better preservation than the rest of their ilk.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SporeSkeleton: Skeletons meandering through more moist caverns become hosts for glowing fungal growth, greatly empowering them.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_SporeBat: The tables have turned on a variety of rabid bats, themselves enwrought with a deadly fungal infection.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BestiaryGirl: The Zoologist, resident lycanthrope, adores animals. Her fox-like biology resulted from a cursed animal bite.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownCat: Lazy, devious, might bring presents. Presents might have once been breathing.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownDog: A loyal companion to many. Excitable and always ready for action.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownBunny: Guaranteed to keep the vegetable supplies in check. Might possibly become a hat.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_HellButterfly: A solemn butterfly seeking blooms rooted in hell. Its wings glimmer with fiery veins.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Lavafly: A variation of firefly which adapted to the intense conditions of the world's infernal core. It mimics sparking embers.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MagmaSnail: A unique species of snail which withstands extreme heat. Its boiling slime trail melts down most weaker surfaces.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_HallowBoss: Beneath the Hallow's cleansing blanket lies a vengeful fae goddess bent on scrubbing the land of any and all impurity.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_QueenSlimeBoss: Hallowed slimes consolidated into a haughty, crushing force adorned in dazzling crystals. She is rumored to grow wings.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_MaggotZombie: Wanders aimlessly to infest the living with undeath, unaware of its own maggoty infestation.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_QueenSlimeMinionBlue: The blue-spectrumed crystal slimes specialize in growing and ejecting pointed crystal shards from their gelatinous bodies.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_QueenSlimeMinionPink: On the pink side of the crystal spectrum, these crystal slimes pop off tumor-like gel growths to assault their enemies.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_QueenSlimeMinionPurple: Crystal slimes on the purple spectrum grow wings much like their royal creator, becoming aerial threats.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_EmpressButterfly: Should one of these luminescent beings perish in the chaos of night, a sleeping tyrant is rumored to violently awaken.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TorchGod: An unseen deity responsible for a torch's eternal flicker, however easily angered by the unsightly, ungrateful abuse of torch placement.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Princess: Shy and innocent, this happy young lady sees the positive in everything, and everybody. She appreciates all of her subjects, from all walks of life.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Deerclops: Hailing from a distant land, this cyclopic monstrosity lurks in cold places, wreaking havoc on those who disturb it.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Stinkbug: These sneaky pests have a knack for invading even the most airtight of homes, projecting their cilantro-like stench everywhere if disturbed.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ScarletMacaw: A lovely tropical bird with plumage that reminds one of a beautiful sunset over the jungle canopy.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BlueMacaw: Evoking visions of a bright summer sky over crystal blue waters, this tropical bird can be found foraging for seeds in the trees of the jungle.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownSlimeBlue: Just a smidge cleverer than other slimes, this slime discovered how to coexist with humans. The secret: accessorizing!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Toucan: You can often find this brightly-plumed and large-beaked bird looping around high in the trees in search of delicious fruit.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_YellowCockatiel: The distinct plumage of this bird's crest is a tell-tale sign of its emotional state, often raised when it is excited.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_GrayCockatiel: A very social animal by nature, these close cousins of parrots can often be taught to say simple phrases.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownSlimeGreen: Easily the coolest slime around, no question. You can tell from the backwards hat and indecipherable slang.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownSlimeOld: Older, though not necessarily wiser, the other slimes look up to the Elder Slime. If it survived this long, it must know something!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownSlimePurple: This slime was a little confused when the other slimes started putting on hats and accessories. But it did its best.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownSlimeRainbow: Born of the combined energies of Shimmer and the Queen Slime, this slime is full of boundless energy and enthusiasm! And so fancy!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownSlimeRed: Irascible and insufferable, this grumpy slime is probably up to no good. Probably. It's the thought that counts, really.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownSlimeYellow: This slime knows that great witches wear impressive hats, but it only found a droopy one. Might explain the backfired polymorph!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_TownSlimeCopper: A hero amongst slimes, it wields the greatest arms and armor known to its kind. It doesn't actually know how to use them, but it's a start.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_BoundTownSlimeYellow: A curious frog with a funny hat, surrounded by potent magic! Perhaps something can break its curse... you probably shouldn't kiss it!
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_Shimmerfly: These scintillating fairy-like creatures are born when animals wander into the glowing depths of a Shimmer pond.
Bestiary_FlavorText.npc_ShimmerSlime: After a quick swim in the Shimmer, this prismatic slime has been infused with the powers of the mysterious fluid.
